projects.description: This app shows a random quote by using basic Javascript skills such as array, variables, loops, conditionals and object literals.
In this project, I wrote Javascript to display 10 names at a time, and add a navigation and search system. It works with  a list of any number of students

This project is an interative registration form, which has customized conditional behavior and interactivity. Instead of plain "vanilla" JavaScript, I used the popular jQuery library to complete this project.

In this project, I created a browser-based, word guessing game: "Painters Palette." I used JavaScript and OOP (Object-Oriented Programming) to select a random, hidden color, which a player tries to guess, by not only clicking letters on an onscreen keyboard, but also real time keyboard functionality.

In this project, I wrote an app to share contact information for a fiction startup company. The app requests a JSON object from a public API by using "Synchronous" fetch with async/await. Then, it parses the data so that 12 employees are listed in a grid. Clicking the employee’s image or name will open a modal window with more detailed information, such as the employee’s birthday and address.
